title: Elephant deaths surge due to govt misinformation: Researcher
byline: The increase in elephant deaths has been influenced by wrong measures being taken by the current government and the word being spread on social media, presenting falsehoods, Wild elephant researcher Sameera Weerathunga said.

title: Rejection of nominations: CA to deliver order tomorrow
byline: The Court of Appeal announced that its order on the writ petitions challenging the rejection of nominations for the upcoming local government elections will be delivered tomorrow.

title: Alarming rise in road accidents: 292 deaths reported in first three months
byline: An alarming number of road accidents have been recorded this year, with 565 accidents and 292 deaths reported in the first three months, Traffic Control and Road Safety Director SSP Indika Hapugoda said.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon further remanded
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has been ordered to be further remanded until April 10 by the Matara Magistrate’s Court.

title: US mayor records lewd video for girlfriend, mistakenly sends to city attorney
byline: A mayor in the United States has resigned after sending a sexually explicit video to the local city attorney. Tom Ross, the now-former mayor of Minot in North Dakota, admitted that he ’mistakenly’ sent a video of himself masturbating on his lunch break to City Attorney Stefanie Stalheim.

title: Wildlife Department plans urgent action to cut deaths from elephant-human conflict by 20%
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department aims to implement an urgent action plan to reduce deaths from elephant-human conflicts in the country by 20% before the end of this year.

title: Myanmar earthquake toll crosses 3,000
byline: Extreme heat and heavy rain in Myanmar could cause disease outbreaks among earthquake survivors camping in the open, global aid bodies warned on Thursday, complicating rescue efforts made difficult by a civil war, as the death toll surpassed 3,000.

title: Kin of late Sri Lankan detained in Japan to seek all footage shown over her death
byline: The bereaved family of a Sri Lankan woman who died in detention at an immigration facility in Japan in 2021 will file a lawsuit seeking the disclosure of all security camera footage leading up to her death, the family’s lawyers said Thursday.

title: College of Psychiatrists concerned about low-priced alcohol
byline: The Sri Lanka College of Psychiatrists has expressed concerns regarding the excise department’s recent decision to introduce a low-priced alcoholic beverage in Sri Lanka.

title: HC sentences man to death for heroin trafficking
byline: Colombo High Court Judge R.S.S. Sapuwida, today sentenced an accused to death after convicting him on two charges of possession of 16 grams and 882 milligrams of heroin and trafficking the substance.

title: World leaders criticise Trump tariffs as ’major blow’
byline: Donald Trump’s decision to impose new tariffs on all goods entering the US is a ’’major blow to the world economy’’, European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen has said.

title: President appoints committee to assess impact of new US tariff system
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a high-level committee to to conduct an in-depth study on potential issues that may arise due to the new reciprocal tariff system introduced by US President Donald Trump and to submit recommendations to the government.

title: Oil prices fall into negative territory as Trump announces new tariffs
byline: Oil prices fell to negative territory after rising by a dollar in post-settlement trade on Wednesday as U.S. President Donald Trump announced reciprocal tariffs on trading partners, stoking concerns that a global trade war may dampen demand for crude.

title: S.M. Ranjith files appeal challenging High Court judgment
byline: Former Chief Minister of the North Central Province S.M. Ranjith and his private secretary Shanthi Chandrasena, the spouse of former Minister S.M. Chandrasena, filed an appeal petition today before the Court of Appeal challenging the Colombo High Court’s judgment, which convicted them and imposed 16 years of rigorous imprisonment over a case filed by the Bribery Commission.

title: Animal census at potential risk of inaccurate responses
byline: The committee members tasked with analyzing data from the recently conducted animal census are in dilemma over receiving distorted data, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Will review multifaceted India-Sri Lanka friendship and discuss newer avenues: Modi
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Sri Lanka and India will review the multifaceted India-Sri Lanka friendship and discuss newer avenues of cooperation during his visit to Sri Lanka.

title: CID arrests trio for altering data to steal Rs. 27 Mn from Ayurvedic Corporation
byline: Three suspects, including two women, were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for defrauding over Rs. 27 million from the Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation.

title: Sri Lanka shines at ULT Travel Expo 2025 in Luxembourg
byline: Sri Lanka captivated attention as a top-tier travel destination at the ULT Travel Expo, held at the Parc Hotel Alvisse in Luxembourg. The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Brussels, alongside leading Sri Lankan travel companies Jetwing Travels (Pvt) Ltd and Walkers Tours Limited, showcased the island nation’s unique offerings to an enthusiastic audience.

title: Sri Lanka braces for US reciprocal tariffs
byline: Sri Lanka faces potential export headwinds as reciprocal tariffs imposed by the United States take effect today. Key sectors such as apparel and rubber products are particularly vulnerable.
